pullRequest.title: Bump greenplum-db/gp-common-go-libs to latest
pullRequest.bodyText:
This version of the libs contains a change that simplifies running
things on master standby and executing commands from local (rsync,
useful in pxf cluster sync command).
Authored-by: Oliver Albertini oalbertini@pivotal.io

afterCommit.message:
Bump greenplum-db/gp-common-go-libs to latest

This version of the libs contains changes that simplify running
things on master standby and executing commands from local (rsync,
useful in pxf cluster sync command).

Also makes it easier to run things on hosts (passing a function that
takes a string instead of contentID to gp-common-go-libs).

Also improves usage of cluster API so we can stop counting hosts in our
code.

Authored-by: Oliver Albertini <oalbertini@pivotal.io>

nodes.bodyText:
Can we say

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            			status:  "Initializing PXF on %d hosts including master...\n",
          
          
            
            			status:  "Initializing PXF on master and %d host%s...\n",
          
      
    
    
  

instead?
For example, Initializing PXF on master and 1 host for 1 master and 1 host, and
Initializing PXF on master and 3 hosts
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -108,12 +108,12 @@ var (
 		name: pxfInit,
 		messages: map[messageType]string{
 			success: "PXF initialized successfully on %d out of %d hosts\n",
-			status:  "Initializing PXF on master and %d other hosts...\n",
+			status:  "Initializing PXF on %d hosts including master...\n",

nodes.bodyText: Is cluster.INCLUDE_MIRRORS needed in case the mirrors are not collocated with segments?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -108,12 +108,12 @@ var (
 		name: pxfInit,
 		messages: map[messageType]string{
 			success: "PXF initialized successfully on %d out of %d hosts\n",
-			status:  "Initializing PXF on master and %d other hosts...\n",
+			status:  "Initializing PXF on %d hosts including master...\n",
 			err:     "PXF failed to initialize on %d out of %d hosts\n",
 		},
 		warn:       false,
 		envVars:    []envVar{gphome, pxfConf, javaHome},
-		whereToRun: cluster.ON_HOSTS_AND_MASTER,
+		whereToRun: cluster.ON_REMOTE | cluster.ON_HOSTS | cluster.INCLUDE_MASTER | cluster.INCLUDE_MIRRORS,

nodes.bodyText: do you need to explicitly exclude master and mirrors here? What's the whereToRun behavior? all enabled by default?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -124,7 +124,7 @@ var (
 		},
 		warn:       false,
 		envVars:    []envVar{gphome},
-		whereToRun: cluster.ON_HOSTS,
+		whereToRun: cluster.ON_REMOTE | cluster.ON_HOSTS | cluster.EXCLUDE_MASTER | cluster.EXCLUDE_MIRRORS,

beforeCommit.message:
Bump greenplum-db/gp-common-go-libs to latest

This version of the libs contains changes that simplify running
things on master standby and executing commands from local (rsync,
useful in pxf cluster sync command).

Also makes it easier to run things on hosts (passing a function that
takes a string instead of contentID to gp-common-go-libs).

Also improves usage of cluster API so we can stop counting hosts in our
code.

Authored-by: Oliver Albertini <oalbertini@pivotal.io>

afterCommit.message:
Bump greenplum-db/gp-common-go-libs to latest

This version of the libs contains changes that simplify running
things on master standby and executing commands from local (rsync,
useful in pxf cluster sync command).

Also makes it easier to run things on hosts (passing a function that
takes a string instead of contentID to gp-common-go-libs).

Also improves usage of cluster API so we can stop counting hosts in our
code and command status, success, error reporting.

commit.message:
Go CLI: Update README

* Adds instructions for debugging with dlv on a remote system
* Adds instructions for updating deps

Add pipeline for testing PXF CLI

* Allow skipping Hadoop setup, since we don't need Hadoop to test the
  CLI.
* It allows using a standby master (smdw) using CCP
* Run pxf cli tests from mdw
* The pipeline revealed a bug with JAVA_HOME: when the user tries to
  change the JAVA_HOME by resetting the cluster then initializing again
  with a new cluster, the old JAVA_HOME would always be used. Now we
  have some logic to preserve JAVA_HOME when user is initializing.

Authored-by: Oliver Albertini <oalbertini@pivotal.io>

Bump greenplum-db/gp-common-go-libs to latest

This version of the libs contains changes that simplify running
things on master standby and executing commands from local (rsync,
useful in pxf cluster sync command).

Also makes it easier to run things on hosts (passing a function that
takes a string instead of contentID to gp-common-go-libs).

Also improves usage of cluster API so we can stop counting hosts in our
code and command status, success, error reporting.

Authored-by: Oliver Albertini <oalbertini@pivotal.io>
